@dkhamsing - what are the other possible attributes that can be listed to tags?

tags: List of app attribute tags, use swift if the app is written in Swift

@michieriffic There are two tags at the moment, `swift` and `archive` (both as strings). If you need help understanding the structure, check out the [schema.json](https://github.com/dkhamsing/open-source-ios-apps/blob/master/.github/schema.json), it has all of the currently supported elements and a brief description for all of them.

@dkhamsing I've noticed there were quite a few notifications from this project lately, sorry I haven't been able to help but I am currently traveling so I can't really work on this stuff much. Congrats on breaking 500 apps!! :cake:

@scribblemaniac thanks. What does 'archive' mean as a tag? thanks. :)
@scribblemaniac no worries

@michieriffic Apps with the archive tag no longer build. Instead of being put in the main README.md, they are put in ARCHIVE.md. For the app, it could in my opinion be put in a separate section, grayed out, or just ignored entirely.

@dkhamsing what do you think to improve the AwesomeSwift app in order to get data from both the two JSON, we already share format so we can easily reach that goal with a sort of swiss army knife app for devs.

@michieriffic if you want you can have a look at this already existing (and open sourced) app that we use in [AwesomeSwift](https://github.com/matteocrippa/awesome-swift) - https://github.com/matteocrippa/awesomeSwift-iOS-App

@dkhamsing what do you think to improve the AwesomeSwift app in order to get data from both the two JSON, we already share format so we can easily reach that goal with a sort of swiss army knife app for devs.

@michieriffic if you want you can have a look at this already existing (and open sourced) app that we use in [AwesomeSwift](https://github.com/matteocrippa/awesome-swift) - https://github.com/matteocrippa/awesomeSwift-iOS-App
Forking or using @matteocrippa's app could be a starting point

@dkhamsing I think what @matteocrippa is suggesting is to combine both Awesome Swift and Open Source iOS as one app as it complements each other. Am I correct? 

Actually, I have thought of this last night and saw a lot of Awesome List available which can be combined in one app. 

Because the new Apple Guidelines is suggesting that if you're just making the same app and just changing its content, it's better to create one app. 

> Apple Review Guidelines 4.3 
> Don‚Äôt create multiple Bundle IDs of the same app. If your app has different versions for specific locations, sports teams, universities, etc., consider submitting a single app and provide the variations using in-app purchase. 

The only thing about Awesome is that the list should be curated, while open source iOS is pulling all the possible open source iOS app available. 

Overall, I've research possible design styles that would best suit the app. :)

@dkhamsing I think what @matteocrippa is suggesting is to combine both Awesome Swift and Open Source iOS as one app as it complements each other. Am I correct?

The only thing about Awesome is that the list should be curated, while open source iOS is pulling all the possible open source iOS app available. 

Overall, I've research possible design styles that would best suit the app. :)

@matteocrippa i'll try to make a version of my app first and see what I can integrate in from your app. I've seen your repo and you are using LeeGo for the UI and I prefer using the storyboard or doing the UI using Apple's Framework. :) 

@dkhamsing are you ok with that? :)

@matteocrippa i'll try to make a version of my app first and see what I can integrate in from your app. I've seen your repo and you are using LeeGo for the UI and I prefer using the storyboard or doing the UI using Apple's Framework. :)

@michieriffic if you can wait a couple of days I'll push a new version of the app in a separate branch that strip off the POC of LeeGo, making use of Storyboard and XIBs for max reusability and faster UI development.
If you want in the meanwhile feel free to share a mockup of the idea so we can work in order to review that first and figure out how to implement.

@michieriffic if you want have a look at this https://github.com/matteocrippa/awesomeSwift-iOS-App/tree/feature/newUI I pushed an early setup, if you want have a look at CreditsViewController to figure out how to approach.

In order to avoid merge issues, I strongly suggest to keep the storyboard as simple as possibile, but make use of XIBs

WIP ‚Üí https://dkhamsing.github.io/open-source-ios-apps/ by @scribblemaniac üéâ 

---

This is an extension of a suggestions made in #387.

The idea is that instead of just generating a README for this repository that has a formatted list of all of the OS Apps, a webpage on this project's Github Pages branch is created to display the apps. With the added flexibility of HTML, CSS, and Javascript, people will be able to interact with our content like never before. Filters, searches, expandable content, video demonstrations, better theming, you name it!

Obviously none of this will happen without work, so here is a very basic summary of what needs to be done:
- [x] Language flags
- [x] Theme switching (just swap the bootstrap stylesheets)
- [x] Improve tooltip display
- [x] Persistent settings
- [x] Screenshots
- [x] Parse markdown links
- [x] Fix internal links scrolling too far
- [x] Splash screen with loading bar
- [x] Fix links to users in "suggested by"
- [x] Background refresh
- [ ] Manual refresh
- [ ] Search
- [ ] Filtering
- [ ] Logo (see #413)
- [ ] Handle links in app descriptions
- [ ] Improve accessibility
- [ ] Sort order option
- [ ] Optimization
- [ ] Improve content (more tags, homepages, screenshots, etc. in the contents.json file)
- [ ] Filter out archived items
- [ ] Load projects for a particular `tag` (see #421)
- [ ] Screenshot thumbnails
- [ ] Refactor JS code
- [ ] Documentation
- [ ] Compress contents.json

If anyone with UX experience is reading this, we would love your help. I can help with the programming and content portions later this month.

@dkhamsing What is your position on this? Feel free to make improvements.
